archdesc.runner: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.unittitle:
The Merritt T. Cooke Memorial Virginia Print Collection
1857-1907

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: The Merritt T. Cooke Memorial Virginia Print Collection, Accession #9408, Special Collections, University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was given to the library as a gift from Mrs. Merritt T. Cooke on 1970 January 16.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Include lithographs, engravings, etchings, and watercolors, 1857-1907, of scenic and historic Virginia sites, including several of Virginia churches, Richmond, including one of the burning of the Theatre (1811), White Sulphur Springs (Greenbrier County, W. Va.), White Sulphur Springs (Fauquier County), Natural Bridge, Fayette County, W. Va., Peaks of Otter, and the University of Virginia.
Also contains 42 lithographs from Album of Virginia, published in Richmond in 1858 by Edward Beyer.

did.unittitle: Series II: Edward Beyer Album of VirginiaPrints

unittitle.title: Album of Virginia Illustrated by Ed. Beyer 1858.

scopecontent.p: Cover to Volume with 4 small oval engravings and 1 larger one; has engravings of George and Martha Washington on back.

unittitle.title: Blue Sulphur Spring Greenbrier County Va.

scopecontent.p: has autographs of Edw. Bates, A. Appleton, Wm. Pennington and James D. P. Ogden on back

unittitle.title: Bullard Rock on the New River Near the River White Sulphur Spr. Giles County, Va.

scopecontent.p: One has engraving of Luther, Melancthon, Pomeranus, and Crucier on back.

unittitle.title: Burner's White Sulphur Spr. Shenandoah, Co.

scopecontent.p: has autographs of T.L. Clingman, Johabad (?) Goodwin (Gov., N. H.), John Letcher (Va.), S. A. Douglas, A. Lincoln (facsimile), H. Hamlin (facsimile), and W. A. Gioban (?) on back

unittitle.title: The Drums. The Tapestry Room, Weyer's Cave. Central R. R. Augusta County, Va.

scopecontent.p: has autographs of Washington Hunt (Gov., N.Y.), W.A. Buckingham (Gov., Conn.), and Chs. S. Olden (Gov., N.J.) on back

unittitle.title: Falling Springs Batch County Va.

scopecontent.p: has engraving of Fredericus Wilhelmus and autographs of James Buchanan, Sam Houston, Jefferson Davis, and J. R. Ingersoll on back.

unittitle.title: Fauquier White Sulphur Springs Fauquier County Va.

scopecontent.p: has engraving "Peter the Great Saved by His Mother" on back.

unittitle.title: Harper's Ferry from Jefferson Rock Jefferson Co. Va.

scopecontent.p: has autographs of D.S. Duhinson (?), Jethro Arling[?], Jr., H. Winter Davis, and D.D. Barnard on the back.

unittitle.title: The High Bridge Near Farmville

scopecontent.p: has engraving of Henry W. Longfellow on back.

unittitle.title: Hot Springs Bath County, Va.
James River Canal Near the Mouth of the North River Rockbridge County, Va.

scopecontent.p: has autographs of W.L. Sharkey, Tho- Bragg (Gov. N.C.), Joseph Lane, W.E. Sinnus (? M.C., Ky.), and Wm. Pennington (M.C.)

unittitle.title: Kanawha Fall Fayette County, Va.

scopecontent.p: has engravings of John C. Breckenridge and Joseph Lane, and autographs of J. Tyler, Jere. Clemens, Th. S. Bocock, Edward Everett, and J. P. Benjamin on back.

unittitle.title: The Little Tunnel Near Shawsville Va. & T. R. R. Montgomery County, Va.

scopecontent.p: colored. Has engraving by J. Sartain "Richard the Third Endeavoring to Persuade Buckingham..." on the back.

unittitle.title: Natural Bridge Rockbridge Co. Va.

scopecontent.p: has autographs of W.C. Rives, Jas. P. Ogden, Geo, Briggs (M.C.), and W.N.H. Smith, and an engraving of Paul Morphy on back.

unittitle.title: Natural Bridge Rockbridge County, Va.

scopecontent.p: different view from preceding; has engraving "Louis XVI Threatened by the Mob on Their Visit to the Tuileries, June 20, 1792.

unittitle.title: "Old Point Comfort" and "Hygeia Hotel"

scopecontent.p: larger one has engraving of Alexander I of Russia on back.

unittitle.title: Old Sweet Spr. Monroe County Va.

scopecontent.p: has engraving of George D.P. Custis [?[ and Alexander von Humbolt with autographs of Ed. Etheridge, Wm. L. Goggin, Thos, H. Clay, and J(?) Holt on back.

unittitle.title: Red Sulphur Spring Monroe County, Va.

scopecontent.p: has engraving of Rev. James W. Alexander, D.D. on back.

unittitle.title: Red Sweet Springs Monroe County Va.

scopecontent.p: has autographs of I. Towcey, Rev. Thompson, Geo, Briggs, A.B. Moore (Gov., Ala.), and Henry W. Hilliard on back

unittitle.title: Roanoke Red Sulphur Spr. Roanoke Co.
Rockbridge Alum Spring Rockbridge County Va.

scopecontent.p: has facsimile of poem by Thos. Hoors (?)

unittitle.title: Rockfish Gap and the Mountain House Central R.R. Augusta Co. Va.

scopecontent.p: has autographs of M. Van Buren, John S. Milburn, W.W. Seaton, B. Magoffin (Gov., Ky.), and John B. Floyd (Gov., Va.) on back

unittitle.title: The Salt Pond From the Salt Pond Knob Giles County Va. No. 1

scopecontent.p: has autographs of Lewis Cass, A.N. Botele (?), J.M. Morehead, and A.J. Hopkins on back.

unittitle.title: The Salt Pond From the Salt Pond Knob Giles County Va. No. 2

scopecontent.p: different view from above.

unittitle.title: Salt Suphur Spring Monroe County Va.

scopecontent.p: has engravings of cartoons of Lord North and Mr. Fox, of Mr. Pitt and Mr. Burke, and a portrait engraving of J.A. Quitman on back.

unittitle.title: Stribling Springs Central R.R. Augusta County Va.

scopecontent.p: has autographs of W.C. Rives, Thomas G. Turner (Gov., R.I.), B. H. Hill (Ga.), and Wm. L. Dayton on back.

unittitle.title: U.S. Armory in Harpers Ferry Jefferson County Va.

unittitle.title: View from Gambles Hill Richmond Va.

scopecontent.p: has signed engraving of Andrew Jackson, and an engraved silhouette of (Jackson) on back.

unittitle.title: View from Little Sewell Mountain No. 1 Fayette County, Va.

scopecontent.p: one trimmed more than the other; large print has autographs of Winfield Scott, Balie Peyton, Geo. Evans, and Leslie Conts (?) on the back.

scopecontent.p: has engraving of bust of Alexander Hamilton with facsimile of signed note by Hamilton

unittitle.title: Views of Weyer's Cave Augusta Co. Virginia taken from Nature by Ed Beyer 1856"

unittitle.title: Warm Spring's Bath County Va.

scopecontent.p: has autographs of Edward Everett, John P. Kennedy, C.C. Clay, Jr., John Young Brown, ?,?, Wm. H. Gist (Gov., S.C.), Hor. Binner and Henry M. Fuller on back.

unittitle.title: White Sulphur Springs Greenbrier Co. Va.

unittitle.title: The Burning of the Theatre in Richmond, Virginia, on the Night of the 26th December 1811, by which Awful Calamity, upwards of seventy five of its most valuable Citizens suddenly lost their lives, and many others, were much injured.

scopecontent.p: Published Feb- 25, 1812, by B. Tanner, No. 74 South St. Philadelphia.

unittitle.title: Encampment of the Convention Army at Charlotte Ville in Virginia after they had surrendered to the Americans.
